ConfigItem.Name: SecureMode
ConfigItem.Description: Disables the web installer (http://yourhost.example.com/otrs/installer.pl), to prevent the system from being hijacked. If set to "No", the system can be reinstalled and the current basic configuration will be used to pre-populate the questions within the installer script. If not active, it also disables the GenericAgent, PackageManager and SQL Box.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::DebugMode
ConfigItem.Description: Enables or disables the debug mode over frontend interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::TemplateCache
ConfigItem.Description: Enables or disables the caching for templates. WARNING: Do NOT disable template caching for production environments for it will cause a massive performance drop! This setting should only be disabled for debugging reasons!

ConfigItem.Name: ConfigLevel
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the configuration level of the administrator. Depending on the config level, some sysconfig options will be not shown. The config levels are in in ascending order: Expert, Advanced, Beginner. The higher the config level is (e.g. Beginner is the highest), the less likely is it that the user can accidentally configure the system in a way that it is not usable any more.

ConfigItem.Name: ConfigImportAllowed
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if the admin is allowed to import a saved system configuration in SysConfig.

ConfigItem.Name: ProductName
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the application, shown in the web interface, tabs and title bar of the web browser.

ConfigItem.Name: SystemID
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the system identifier. Every ticket number and http session string contains this ID. This ensures that only tickets which belong to your system will be processed as follow-ups (useful when communicating between two instances of OTRS).

ConfigItem.Name: FQDN
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the fully qualified domain name of the system. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

ConfigItem.Name: NodeID
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the cluster node identifier. This is only used in cluster configurations where there is more than one OTRS frontend system. Note: only values from 1 to 99 are allowed.

ConfigItem.Name: HttpType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the type of protocol, used by the web server, to serve the application. If https protocol will be used instead of plain http, it must be specified here. Since this has no affect on the web server's settings or behavior, it will not change the method of access to the application and, if it is wrong, it will not prevent you from logging into the application. This setting is only used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

ConfigItem.Name: ScriptAlias
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the prefix to the scripts folder on the server, as configured on the web server. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within the system.

ConfigItem.Name: AdminEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the system administrator's email address. It will be displayed in the error screens of the application.

ConfigItem.Name: Organization
ConfigItem.Description: Company name which will be included in outgoing emails as an X-Header.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultLanguage
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default front-end language. All the possible values are determined by the available language files on the system (see the next setting).

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultUsedLanguages
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the languages that are available to the application. The Key/Content pair links the front-end display name to the appropriate language PM file. The "Key" value should be the base-name of the PM file (i.e. de.pm is the file, then de is the "Key" value). The "Content" value should be the display name for the front-end. Specify any own-defined language here (see the developer documentation http://otrs.github.io/doc/ for more infomation). Please remember to use the HTML equivalents for non-ASCII characters (i.e. for the German oe = o umlaut, it is necessary to use the ö symbol).

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultTheme
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default front-end (HTML) theme to be used by the agents and customers. If you like, you can add your own theme. Please refer the administrator manual located at http://otrs.github.io/doc/.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultTheme::HostBased
ConfigItem.Description: It is possible to configure different themes, for example to distinguish between agents and customers, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid theme on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerHeadline
ConfigItem.Description: The headline shown in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerLogo
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown in the header of the customer interface. The URL to the image can be a relative URL to the skin image directory, or a full URL to a remote web server.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentLogo
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface. The URL to the image can be a relative URL to the skin image directory, or a full URL to a remote web server.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentLogoCustom###default
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "default". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentLogoCustom###slim
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "slim". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentLogoCustom###ivory
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "ivory". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentLogoCustom###ivory-slim
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "ivory-slim". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentLoginLogo
ConfigItem.Description: The logo shown on top of the login box of the agent interface. The URL to the image must be relative URL to the skin image directory.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::WebPath
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the URL base path of icons, CSS and Java Script.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::ImagePath
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the URL image path of icons for navigation.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CSSPath
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the URL CSS path.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::JavaScriptPath
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the URL java script path.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichText
ConfigItem.Description: Uses richtext for viewing and editing: articles, salutations, signatures, standard templates, auto responses and notifications.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichTextPath
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the URL rich text editor path.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichTextWidth
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the width for the rich text editor component. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichTextHeight
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the height for the rich text editor component. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichText::DefaultCSS
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default CSS used in rich text editors.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichText::EnhancedMode
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if the enhanced mode should be used (enables use of table, replace, subscript, superscript, paste from word, etc.).

ConfigItem.Name: DisableMSIFrameSecurityRestricted
ConfigItem.Description: Disable restricted security for IFrames in IE. May be required for SSO to work in IE8.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultViewNewLine
ConfigItem.Description: Automated line break in text messages after x number of chars.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultViewLines
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the number of lines that are displayed in text messages (e.g. ticket lines in the QueueZoom).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::AnimationEnabled
ConfigItem.Description: Turns on the animations used in the GUI. If you have problems with these animations (e.g. performance issues), you can turn them off here.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::MenuDragDropEnabled
ConfigItem.Description: Turns on drag and drop for the main navigation.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeInputFormat
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the date input format used in forms (option or input fields).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeShowAlwaysLong
ConfigItem.Description: Shows time in long format (days, hours, minutes), if set to "Yes"; or in short format (days, hours), if set to "No".

ConfigItem.Name: AttachmentDownloadType
ConfigItem.Description: Allows choosing between showing the attachments of a ticket in the browser (inline) or just make them downloadable (attachment).

ConfigItem.Name: CheckMXRecord
ConfigItem.Description: Makes the application check the MX record of email addresses before sending an email or submitting a telephone or email ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: CheckMXRecord::Nameserver
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the address of a dedicated DNS server, if necessary, for the "CheckMXRecord" look-ups.

ConfigItem.Name: CheckEmailAddresses
ConfigItem.Description: Makes the application check the syntax of email addresses.

ConfigItem.Name: CheckEmailValidAddress
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a regular expression that excludes some addresses from the syntax check (if "CheckEmailAddresses" is set to "Yes"). Please enter a regex in this field for email addresses, that aren't syntactically valid, but are necessary for the system (i.e. "root@localhost").

ConfigItem.Name: CheckEmailInvalidAddress
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a regular expression that filters all email addresses that should not be used in the application.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::ViewMode
ConfigItem.Description: Determines the way the linked objects are displayed in each zoom mask.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::Type###Normal
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the link type 'Normal'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one; otherwise, the result is a directional link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::Type###ParentChild
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the link type 'ParentChild'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one; otherwise, the result is a directional link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::TypeGroup###0001
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the link type groups. The link types of the same group cancel one another. Example: If ticket A is linked per a 'Normal' link with ticket B, then these tickets could not be additionally linked with link of a 'ParentChild' relationship.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the log module for the system. "File" writes all messages in a given logfile, "SysLog" uses the syslog daemon of the system, e.g. syslogd.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::SysLog::Facility
ConfigItem.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, a special log facility can be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::SysLog::LogSock
ConfigItem.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, a special log sock can be specified (on solaris you may need to use 'stream').

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::SysLog::Charset
ConfigItem.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, the charset that should be used for logging can be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::LogFile
ConfigItem.Description: If "file" was selected for LogModule, a logfile must be specified. If the file doesn't exist, it will be created by the system.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::LogFile::Date
ConfigItem.Description: Adds a suffix with the actual year and month to the OTRS log file. A logfile for every month will be created.

ConfigItem.Name: MinimumLogLevel
ConfigItem.Description: Set minimum loglevel. If you select 'error', just errors are logged. With 'debug' you get all logging messages.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to send emails. "Sendmail" directly uses the sendmail binary of your operating system. Any of the "SMTP" mechanisms use a specified (external) mailserver. "DoNotSendEmail" doesn't send emails and it is useful for test systems.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::CMD
ConfigItem.Description: If "Sendmail" was selected as SendmailModule, the location of the sendmail binary and the needed options must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::Host
ConfigItem.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the mailhost that sends out the mails must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::Port
ConfigItem.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the port where your mailserver is listening for incoming connections must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::AuthUser
ConfigItem.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, and authentication to the mail server is needed, an username must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::AuthPassword
ConfigItem.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, and authentication to the mail server is needed, a password must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailBcc
ConfigItem.Description: Sends all outgoing email via bcc to the specified address. Please use this only for backup reasons.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailEnvelopeFrom
ConfigItem.Description: If set, this address is used as envelope sender in outgoing messages (not notifications - see below). If no address is specified, the envelope sender is equal to queue e-mail address.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom
ConfigItem.Description: If set, this address is used as envelope sender header in outgoing notifications. If no address is specified, the envelope sender header is empty.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailEncodingForce
ConfigItem.Description: Forces encoding of outgoing emails (7bit|8bit|quoted-printable|base64).

ConfigItem.Name: LoginURL
ConfigItem.Description: Defines an alternate URL, where the login link refers to.

ConfigItem.Name: LogoutURL
ConfigItem.Description: Defines an alternate URL, where the logout link refers to.

ConfigItem.Name: PreApplicationModule###AgentInfo
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a useful module to load specific user options or to display news.

ConfigItem.Name: InfoKey
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the key to be checked with Kernel::Modules::AgentInfo module. If this user preferences key is true, the message is accepted by the system.

ConfigItem.Name: InfoFile
ConfigItem.Description: File that is displayed in the Kernel::Modules::AgentInfo module, if located under Kernel/Output/HTML/Templates/Standard/AgentInfo.tt.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::HeaderMetaModule###100-Refresh
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to generate code for periodic page reloads.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###100-OTRSBusiness
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in different interfaces on different occasions for OTRS Business Solution™.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-OTRSBusiness
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in different interfaces on different occasions for OTRS Business Solution™.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###200-UID-Check
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the system is used by the admin user (normally you shouldn't work as admin).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###300-ShowAgentOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module that shows all the currently logged in agents in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###400-ShowCustomerOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module that shows all the currently loged in customers in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###500-OutofOffice-Check
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent is logged in while having out-of-office active.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###600-SystemMaintenance-Check
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent is logged in while having system maintenance active.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###900-Generic
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module that shows a generic notification in the agent interface. Either "Text" - if configured - or the contents of "File" will be displayed.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionModule
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module used to store the session data. With "DB" the frontend server can be splitted from the db server. "FS" is faster.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionName
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the session key. E.g. Session, SessionID or OTRS.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSessionName
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the key for customer sessions.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionCheckRemoteIP
ConfigItem.Description: Turns on the remote ip address check. It should be set to "No" if the application is used, for example, via a proxy farm or a dialup connection, because the remote ip address is mostly different for the requests.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionDeleteIfNotRemoteID
ConfigItem.Description: Deletes a session if the session id is used with an invalid remote IP address.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionMaxTime
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the maximal valid time (in seconds) for a session id.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionMaxIdleTime
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the inactivity time (in seconds) to pass before a session is killed and a user is loged out.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionActiveTime
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the time (in seconds) a user is marked as active.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionDeleteIfTimeToOld
ConfigItem.Description: Deletes requested sessions if they have timed out.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionUseCookie
ConfigItem.Description: Makes the session management use html cookies. If html cookies are disabled or if the client browser disabled html cookies, then the system will work as usual and append the session id to the links.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionUseCookieAfterBrowserClose
ConfigItem.Description: Stores cookies after the browser has been closed.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionCSRFProtection
ConfigItem.Description: Protection against CSRF (Cross Site Request Forgery) exploits (for more info see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery).

ConfigItem.Name: AgentSessionLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the maximum number of active agents within the timespan defined in SessionActiveTime.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentSessionPerUserLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the maximum number of active sessions per agent within the timespan defined in SessionActiveTime.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerSessionLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the maximum number of active customers within the timespan defined in SessionActiveTime.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerSessionPerUserLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the maximum number of active sessions per customers within the timespan defined in SessionActiveTime.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionDir
ConfigItem.Description: If "FS" was selected for SessionModule, a directory where the session data will be stored must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionTable
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for SessionModule, a table in database where session data will be stored must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the system time zone (required a system with UTC as system time). Otherwise this is a diff time to the local time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZoneUser
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the user time zone per user (required a system with UTC as system time and UTC under TimeZone). Otherwise this is a diff time to the local time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZoneUserBrowserAutoOffset
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the user time zone per user based on java script / browser time zone offset feature at login time.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar1Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar2Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar3Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar4Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar5Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar6Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar7Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar8Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar9Name
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

ConfigItem.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar. Please use single digit pattern for numbers from 1 to 9 (instead of 01 - 09).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: WebMaxFileUpload
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the maximal size (in bytes) for file uploads via the browser. Warning: Setting this option to a value which is too low could cause many masks in your OTRS instance to stop working (probably any mask which takes input from the user).

ConfigItem.Name: WebUploadCacheModule
ConfigItem.Description: Selects the module to handle uploads via the web interface. "DB" stores all uploads in the database, "FS" uses the file system.

ConfigItem.Name: CGILogPrefix
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the text that should appear in the log file to denote a CGI script entry.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::FilterText###AAAURL
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the filter that processes the text in the articles, in order to highlight URLs.

ConfigItem.Name: LostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Activates lost password feature for agents, in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: ShowMotd
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the message of the day on login screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: DemoSystem
ConfigItem.Description: Runs the system in "Demo" mode. If set to "Yes", agents can change preferences, such as selection of language and theme via the agent web interface. These changes are only valid for the current session. It will not be possible for agents to change their passwords.

ConfigItem.Name: SwitchToUser
ConfigItem.Description: Allows the administrators to login as other users, via the users administration panel.

ConfigItem.Name: SwitchToCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Allows the administrators to login as other customers, via the customer user administration panel.

ConfigItem.Name: SwitchToCustomer::PermissionGroup
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the group where the user needs rw permissions so that he can access the "SwitchToCustomer" feature.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/excel
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of Microsoft Excel files, in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/msword
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of Microsoft Word files, in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/pdf
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of PDF documents, in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###text/xml
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of XML files, in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellChecker
ConfigItem.Description: Enables spell checker support.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellCheckerBin
ConfigItem.Description: Install ispell or aspell on the system, if you want to use a spell checker. Please specify the path to the aspell or ispell binary on your operating system.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellCheckerDictDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default spell checker dictionary.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellCheckerIgnore
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a default list of words, that are ignored by the spell checker.

ConfigItem.Name: WebUserAgent::Timeout
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the timeout (in seconds) for http/ftp downloads.

ConfigItem.Name: WebUserAgent::Proxy
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the connections for http/ftp, via a proxy.

ConfigItem.Name: WebUserAgent::DisableSSLVerification
ConfigItem.Description: Turns off SSL certificate validation, for example if you use a transparent HTTPS proxy. Use at your own risk!

ConfigItem.Name: Package::FileUpload
ConfigItem.Description: Enables file upload in the package manager frontend.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::RepositoryRoot
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the location to get online repository list for additional packages. The first available result will be used.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::RepositoryList
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the list of online repositories. Another installations can be used as repository, for example: Key="http://example.com/otrs/public.pl?Action=PublicRepository;File=" and Content="Some Name".

ConfigItem.Name: Package::RepositoryAccessRegExp
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the IP regular expression for accessing the local repository. You need to enable this to have access to your local repository and the package::RepositoryList is required on the remote host.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::Timeout
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the timeout (in seconds) for package downloads. Overwrites "WebUserAgent::Timeout".

ConfigItem.Name: Package::Proxy
ConfigItem.Description: Fetches packages via proxy. Overwrites "WebUserAgent::Proxy".

ConfigItem.Name: Package::ShowFeatureAddons
ConfigItem.Description: Toggles display of OTRS FeatureAddons list in PackageManager.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::EventModulePost###99-SupportDataSend
ConfigItem.Description: Package event module file a scheduler task for update registration.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###Package
ConfigItem.Description: List of all Package events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###DynamicField
ConfigItem.Description: List of all DynamicField events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: SOAP::User
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the username to access the SOAP handle (bin/cgi-bin/rpc.pl).

ConfigItem.Name: SOAP::Password
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the password to access the SOAP handle (bin/cgi-bin/rpc.pl).

ConfigItem.Name: SOAP::Keep-Alive
ConfigItem.Description: Enable keep-alive connection header for SOAP responses.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::LogoFile
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the path of the file for the logo in the page header (gif|jpg|png, 700 x 100 pixel).

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::PageSize
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the standard size of PDF pages.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::MaxPages
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the maximum number of pages per PDF file.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###Proportional
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalBold
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle italic proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalBoldItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold italic proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###Monospaced
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedBold
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle italic monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedBoldItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold italic monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP
ConfigItem.Description: Enables PGP support. When PGP support is enabled for signing and encrypting mail, it is HIGHLY recommended that the web server runs as the OTRS user. Otherwise, there will be problems with the privileges when accessing .gnupg folder.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Bin
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path to PGP binary.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Options
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the options for PGP binary.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Key::Password
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the password for private PGP key.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::TrustedNetwork
ConfigItem.Description: Set this to yes if you trust in all your public and private pgp keys, even if they are not certified with a trusted signature.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Log
ConfigItem.Description: Configure your own log text for PGP.

Hash.Item: The PGP signature with the keyid is good.
This key is not certified with a trusted signature!.
The PGP signature was made by a revoked key, this could mean that the signature is forged.
The PGP signature was made by a revoked key, this could mean that the signature is forged.
The PGP signature with the keyid has not been verified successfully.
It was not possible to check the PGP signature, this may be caused by a missing public key or an unsupported algorithm.
The PGP signature was made by an expired key.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::StoreDecryptedData
ConfigItem.Description: If this option is enabled, then the decrypted data will be stored in the database if they are displayed in AgentTicketZoom.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME
ConfigItem.Description: Enables S/MIME support.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::Bin
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path to open ssl binary. It may need a HOME env ($ENV{HOME} = '/var/lib/wwwrun';).

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::CertPath
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the directory where SSL certificates are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::PrivatePath
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the directory where private SSL certificates are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::CacheTTL
ConfigItem.Description: Cache time in seconds for the SSL certificate attributes.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::StoreDecryptedData
ConfigItem.Description: If this option is enabled, then the decrypted data will be stored in the database if they are displayed in AgentTicketZoom.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSenderName
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the name that should be used by the application when sending notifications. The sender name is used to build the complete display name for the notification master (i.e. "OTRS Notification Master" otrs@your.example.com). Notifications are messages such as en::Customer::QueueUpdate or en::Agent::Move.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSenderEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the email address that should be used by the application when sending notifications. The email address is used to build the complete display name for the notification master (i.e. "OTRS Notification Master" otrs@your.example.com). You can use the OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN variable as set in your configuation, or choose another email address. Notifications are messages such as en::Customer::QueueUpdate or en::Agent::Move.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSubjectLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to agents, with token about new requested password.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationBodyLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to agents, with token about new requested password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
You or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
If you want to do this, click on the link below. You will receive another email containing the password.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>index.pl?Action=LostPassword;Token=<OTRS_TOKEN>
If you did not request a new password, please ignore this email.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSubjectLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to agents, about new password.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationBodyLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to agents, about new password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
Here's your new OTRS password.
New password: <OTRS_NEWPW>
You can log in via the following URL:
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>index.pl

ConfigItem.Name: System::Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the standard permissions available for agents within the application. If more permissions are needed, you can enter them here. Permissions must be hard coded to be effective. Please ensure, when adding any of the afore mentioned permissions, that the "rw" permission remains the last entry.

ConfigItem.Name: System::Customer::Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the standard permissions available for customers within the application. If more permissions are needed, you can enter them here. Permissions must be hard coded to be effective. Please ensure, when adding any of the afore mentioned permissions, that the "rw" permission remains the last entry.

ConfigItem.Name: ReferenceData::OwnCountryList
ConfigItem.Description: This setting allows you to override the built-in country list with your own list of countries. This is particularly handy if you just want to use a small select group of countries.

ConfigItem.Name: PerformanceLog
ConfigItem.Description: Enables performance log (to log the page response time). It will affect the system performance. Frontend::Module###AdminPerformanceLog must be enabled.

ConfigItem.Name: PerformanceLog::File
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the path of the file for the performance log.

ConfigItem.Name: PerformanceLog::FileMax
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the maximum size (in MB) of the log file.

ConfigItem.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the two-factor module to authenticate agents.

ConfigItem.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule::SecretPreferencesKey
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the agent preferences key where the shared secret key is stored.

ConfigItem.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule::AllowEmptySecret
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if agents should be allowed to login if they have no shared secret stored in their preferences and therefore are not using two-factor authentication.

ConfigItem.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule::AllowPreviousToken
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if the previously valid token should be accepted for authentication. This is slightly less secure but gives users 30 seconds more time to enter their one-time password.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTable
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the table, where the customer preferences are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTableKey
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the column to store the keys for the preferences table.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTableValue
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the column to store the data in the preferences table.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTableUserID
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the name of the column to store the user identifier in the preferences table.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesView
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the display order of the different items in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Password
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###GoogleAuthenticatorSecretKey
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

Hash.Item: Enter your shared secret to enable two factor authentication.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###SpellDict
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Take care to maintain the dictionaries installed in the system in the data section.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Comment
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###DynamicField
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Language
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Skin
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Theme
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###OutOfOffice
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###TimeZone
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###CSVSeparator
ConfigItem.Description: Gives end users the possibility to override the separator character for CSV files, defined in the translation files.

Hash.Item: Select the separator character used in CSV files (stats and searches). If you don't select a separator here, the default separator for your language will be used.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelUserID
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the user identifier for the customer panel.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerGroupSupport
ConfigItem.Description: Activates support for customer groups.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerGroupAlwaysGroups
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the groups every customer user will be in (if CustomerGroupSupport is enabled and you don't want to manage every user for these groups).

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::HeaderMetaModule###1-Refresh
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to generate code for periodic page reloads.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-ShowAgentOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module that shows the currently loged in agents in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-ShowCustomerOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module that shows the currently loged in customers in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###6-CustomerSystemMaintenance-Check
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent is logged in while having system maintenance active.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelLoginURL
ConfigItem.Description: Defines an alternate login URL for the customer panel..

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelLogoutURL
ConfigItem.Description: Defines an alternate logout URL for the customer panel.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###1-GoogleMaps
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a google maps icon at the end of a customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###2-Google
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a google icon at the end of a customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###2-LinkedIn

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###3-XING
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a XING icon at the end of a customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelPreApplicationModule###CustomerAccept
ConfigItem.Description: This module and its PreRun() function will be executed, if defined, for every request. This module is useful to check some user options or to display news about new applications.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanel::InfoKey
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the key to check with CustomerAccept. If this user preferences key is true, then the message is accepted by the system.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanel::InfoFile
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the path of the shown info file, that is located under Kernel/Output/HTML/Templates/Standard/CustomerAccept.tt.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Activates lost password feature for customers.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount
ConfigItem.Description: Enables customers to create their own accounts.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount::MailRestrictions::Whitelist
ConfigItem.Description: If active, one of the regular expressions has to match the user's email address to allow registration.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount::MailRestrictions::Blacklist
ConfigItem.Description: If active, none of the regular expressions may match the user's email address to allow registration.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to customers, with token about new requested password.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelBodyLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to customers, with token about new requested password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
You or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
If you want to do this, click on this link. You will receive another email containing the password.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl?Action=CustomerLostPassword;Token=<OTRS_TOKEN>
If you did not request a new password, please ignore this email.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to customers, about new password.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelBodyLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to customers, about new password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectNewAccount
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to customers, about new account.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelBodyNewAccount
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to customers, about new account.

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
You or someone impersonating you has created a new OTRS account for you.
Full name: <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME> <OTRS_USERLASTNAME> User name: <OTRS_USERLOGIN> Password : <OTRS_USERPASSWORD>
You can log in via the following URL. We encourage you to change your password via the Preferences button after logging in.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the module to authenticate customers.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CryptType
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the crypt type of passwords must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Table
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the name of the table where your customer data should be stored must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CustomerKey
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the name of the column for the CustomerKey in the customer table must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CustomerPassword
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the column name for the CustomerPassword in the customer table must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::DSN
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the DSN for the connection to the customer table must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::User
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, a username to connect to the customer table can be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Password
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, a password to connect to the customer table can be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Type
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, a database driver (normally autodetection is used) can be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::HTTPBasicAuth::Replace
ConfigItem.Description: If "HTTPBasicAuth" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify to strip leading parts of user names (e. g. for domains like example_domain\user to user).

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::HTTPBasicAuth::ReplaceRegExp
ConfigItem.Description: If "HTTPBasicAuth" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify (by using a RegExp) to strip parts of REMOTE_USER (e. g. for to remove trailing domains). RegExp-Note, $1 will be the new Login.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Host
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the LDAP host can be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::BaseDN
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the BaseDN must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UID
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the user identifier must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::GroupDN
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::Authmodule, you can check if the user is allowed to authenticate because he is in a posixGroup, e.g. user needs to be in a group xyz to use OTRS. Specify the group, who may access the system.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::AccessAttr
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify access attributes here.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UserAttr
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, user attributes can be specified. For LDAP posixGroups use UID, for non LDAP posixGroups use full user DN.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::SearchUserDN
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and your users have only anonymous access to the LDAP tree, but you want to search through the data, you can do this with a user who has access to the LDAP directory. Specify the username for this special user here.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::SearchUserPw
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and your users have only anonymous access to the LDAP tree, but you want to search through the data, you can do this with a user who has access to the LDAP directory. Specify the password for this special user here.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::AlwaysFilter
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected, you can add a filter to each LDAP query, e.g. (mail=*), (objectclass=user) or (!objectclass=computer).

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UserSuffix
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and if you want to add a suffix to every customer login name, specifiy it here, e. g. you just want to write the username user but in your LDAP directory exists user@domain.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Params
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and special paramaters are needed for the Net::LDAP perl module, you can specify them here. See "perldoc Net::LDAP" for more information about the parameters.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Die
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify if the applications will stop if e. g. a connection to a server can't be established due to network problems.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Host
ConfigItem.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the radius host must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Password
ConfigItem.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the password to authenticate to the radius host must be specified.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Die
ConfigItem.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify if the applications will stop if e. g. a connection to a server can't be established due to network problems.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthTwoFactorModule
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the two-factor module to authenticate customers.

ConfigItem.Description: Defines if the previously valid token should be accepted for authentication. This is slightly less secure but gives users 30 seconds more time to enter their one-time password.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::StatsHook
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the stats hook.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::StatsStartNumber
ConfigItem.Description: Start number for statistics counting. Every new stat increments this number.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::SearchPageShown
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default maximum number of statistics per page on the overview screen.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DefaultSelectedDynamicObject
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default selection at the drop down menu for dynamic objects (Form: Common Specification).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DefaultSelectedPermissions
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default selection at the drop down menu for permissions (Form: Common Specification).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DefaultSelectedFormat
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default selection at the drop down menu for stats format (Form: Common Specification). Please insert the format key (see Stats::Format).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::SearchLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the search limit for the stats.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Format
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the possible stats output formats.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::ExchangeAxis
ConfigItem.Description: Allows agents to exchange the axis of a stat if they generate one.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::UseAgentElementInStats
ConfigItem.Description: Allows agents to generate individual-related stats.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::UseInvalidAgentInStats
ConfigItem.Description: Allows invalid agents to generate individual-related stats.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::CustomerIDAsMultiSelect
ConfigItem.Description: Shows all the customer identifiers in a multi-select field (not useful if you have a lot of customer identifiers).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::MaxXaxisAttributes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default maximum number of X-axis attributes for the time scale.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::DSN
ConfigItem.Description: OTRS can use one or more readonly mirror databases for expensive operations like fulltext search or statistics generation. Here you can specify the DSN for the first mirror database.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::User
ConfigItem.Description: Specify the username to authenticate for the first mirror database.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::Password
ConfigItem.Description: Specify the password to authenticate for the first mirror database.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::AdditionalMirrors###1
ConfigItem.Description: Configure any additional readonly mirror databases that you want to use.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::AdditionalMirrors###2
ConfigItem.Description: Configure any additional readonly mirror databases that you want to use.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::AdditionalMirrors###3
ConfigItem.Description: Configure any additional readonly mirror databases that you want to use.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::AdditionalMirrors###4
ConfigItem.Description: Configure any additional readonly mirror databases that you want to use.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::AdditionalMirrors###5
ConfigItem.Description: Configure any additional readonly mirror databases that you want to use.

ConfigItem.Name: LanguageDebug
ConfigItem.Description: Debugs the translation set. If this is set to "Yes" all strings (text) without translations are written to STDERR. This can be helpful when you are creating a new translation file. Otherwise, this option should remain set to "No".

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0000-ProductNotify
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" defines the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0390-UserOutOfOffice
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Limit" defines the number of entries displayed by default. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" defines the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0400-UserOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Limit" defines the number of entries displayed by default. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" defines the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0405-News
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Limit" defines the number of entries displayed by default. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0410-RSS
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Limit" defines the number of entries displayed by default. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0420-CmdOutput
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Cmd" is used to specify command with parameters. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0200-Image
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0210-MOTD
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the message of the day (MOTD) in the agent dashboard. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0300-IFrame
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the parameters for the dashboard backend. "Group" is used to restrict access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::AgentLinkObject::WildcardSearch
ConfigItem.Description: Starts a wildcard search of the active object after the link object mask is started.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::FilterText###OutputFilterTextAutoLink
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter to process the text in the articles, in order to highlight predefined keywords.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###CVE
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind CVE numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Bugtraq
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind bugtraq numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###MSBulletins
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind MSBulletin numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Setting1
ConfigItem.Description: Define a filter for html output to add links behind a defined string. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Setting2
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind a defined string. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Secure::DisableBanner
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, the OTRS version tag will be removed from the Webinterface, the HTTP headers and the X-Headers of outgoing mails.

ConfigItem.Name: StandardTemplate2QueueByCreating
ConfigItem.Description: List of default Standard Templates which are assigned automatically to new Queues upon creation.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Enabled::CSS
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, OTRS will deliver all CSS files in minified form. WARNING: If you turn this off, there will likely be problems in IE 7, because it cannot load more than 32 CSS files.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Enabled::JS
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, OTRS will deliver all JavaScript files in minified form.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonCSS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of CSS files to always be loaded for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::ResponsiveCSS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of responsive CSS files to always be loaded for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonJS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of JS files to always be loaded for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonJS###001-JQueryMigrate
ConfigItem.Description: List of JS files to always be loaded for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::CommonCSS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of CSS files to always be loaded for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::ResponsiveCSS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of responsive CSS files to always be loaded for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::CommonJS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of JS files to always be loaded for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::CommonJS###001-JQueryMigrate
ConfigItem.Description: List of JS files to always be loaded for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: OpenMainMenuOnHover
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, the first level of the main menu opens on mouse hover (instead of click only).

ConfigItem.Name: FirstnameLastnameOrder
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the order in which the firstname and the lastname of agents will be displayed.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###000-default
ConfigItem.Description: Default skin for the agent interface.

Hash.Item: This is the default orange - black skin.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###001-slim
ConfigItem.Description: Default skin for the agent interface (slim version).

Hash.Item: "Slim" skin which tries to save screen space for power users.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###001-ivory
ConfigItem.Description: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas.

Hash.Item: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###001-ivory-slim
ConfigItem.Description: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas (slim version).

Hash.Item: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas (slim version).

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::DefaultSelectedSkin
ConfigItem.Description: The agent skin's InternalName which should be used in the agent interface. Please check the available skins in Frontend::Agent::Skins.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::DefaultSelectedSkin::HostBased
ConfigItem.Description: It is possible to configure different skins, for example to distinguish between diferent agents, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid skin on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::Skin###000-default
ConfigItem.Description: Default skin for OTRS 3.0 interface.

Hash.Item: This is the default orange - black skin for OTRS 3.0.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::SelectedSkin
ConfigItem.Description: The customer skin's InternalName which should be used in the customer interface. Please check the available skins in Frontend::Customer::Skins.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::SelectedSkin::HostBased
ConfigItem.Description: It is possible to configure different skins, for example to distinguish between diferent customers, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid skin on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeShowCompleteDescription
ConfigItem.Description: Shows time use complete description (days, hours, minutes), if set to "Yes"; or just first letter (d, h, m), if set to "No".

ConfigItem.Name: AdminCustomerUser::RunInitialWildcardSearch
ConfigItem.Description: Runs an initial wildcard search of the existing customer users when accessing the AdminCustomerUser module.

ConfigItem.Name: AdminCustomerCompany::RunInitialWildcardSearch
ConfigItem.Description: Runs an initial wildcard search of the existing customer company when accessing the AdminCustomerCompany module.

ConfigItem.Name: AdminSelectBox::AllowDatabaseModification
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if the admin is allowed to make changes to the database via AdminSelectBox.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###CustomerUser
ConfigItem.Description: List of all CustomerUser events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###CustomerCompany
ConfigItem.Description: List of all CustomerCompany events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerCompany::EventModulePost###100-UpdateCustomerUsers
ConfigItem.Description: Event module that updates customer users after an update of the Customer.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerUser::EventModulePost###100-UpdateServiceMembership
ConfigItem.Description: Event module that updates customer user service membership if login changes.

ConfigItem.Name: Cache::Module
ConfigItem.Description: Selects the cache backend to use.

ConfigItem.Name: Cache::InMemory
ConfigItem.Description: Should the cache data be help in memory?

ConfigItem.Name: Cache::InBackend
ConfigItem.Description: Should the cache data be stored in the selected cache backend?

ConfigItem.Name: Cache::SubdirLevels
ConfigItem.Description: Specify how many sub directory levels to use when creating cache files. This should prevent too many cache files being in one directory.

ConfigItem.Name: AutoComplete::Agent###Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config options for the autocompletion feature.

ConfigItem.Name: AutoComplete::Agent###CustomerSearch
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config options for the autocompletion feature.

ConfigItem.Name: AutoComplete::Agent###UserSearch
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config options for the autocompletion feature.

ConfigItem.Name: AutoComplete::Customer###Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the config options for the autocompletion feature.

ConfigItem.Name: PossibleNextActions
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the list of possible next actions on an error screen.

ConfigItem.Name: SystemMaintenance::TimeNotifyUpcomingMaintenance
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the minutes a notification is shown for notice about upcoming system maintenance period.

ConfigItem.Name: SystemMaintenance::IsActiveDefaultNotification
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the default message for the notification is shown on a running system maintenance period.

ConfigItem.Name: SystemMaintenance::IsActiveDefaultLoginMessage
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the default message for the login screen on Agent and Customer interface, it's shown when a running system maintenance period is active.

Setting.String: We are performing scheduled maintenance. We should be back online shortly.

ConfigItem.Name: SystemMaintenance::IsActiveDefaultLoginErrorMessage
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the default error message for the login screen on Agent and Customer interface, it's shown when a running system maintenance period is active.

Setting.String: We are performing scheduled maintenance. Login is temporarily not available.

ConfigItem.Name: OTRSBusiness::ReleaseChannel
ConfigItem.Description: Specify the channel to be used to fetch OTRS Business Solution™ updates. Warning: Development releases might not be complete, your system might experience unrecoverable errors and on extreme cases could become unresponsive!

ConfigItem.Name: ModernizeFormFields
ConfigItem.Description: Use new type of select and autocomplete fields in agent interface, where applicable (InputFields).

ConfigItem.Name: ModernizeCustomerFormFields
ConfigItem.Description: Use new type of select and autocomplete fields in customer interface, where applicable (InputFields).

ConfigItem.Name: Fetchmail::Bin
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the fall-back path to open fetchmail binary. Note: The name of the binary needs to be 'fetchmail', if it is different please use a symbolic link.
